content.description:
This is a fun little climb on a nice face.  Start on the left side of the face and finish on the right.  The anchors are out of sight just over the top of the climb above

Two Chicken

.
content.protection: A single set of cams, nuts.
content.location: It is on the South face of the last pillar you come to in the cirque.

climbs.name: Two Chicken
climbs.fa: No one - us two are chickens

content.description:
This has only been top roped because we are chickens.  Even with cleaning, there are some places that make us nervous.  This is a decent little climb that shares anchors with

Two Short

.
content.location: It is on the East face of the last pillar in the cirque.

content.description:
This would not the reason you came, but if you are there, you may as well get on 'er.  It is a mellow warm up with a mix of gear and bolts for protection.  Once you locate the bolts on the East face of the main pillar (around the corner to the left of

The Main Attraction

), the line is pretty obvious.  After the last bolt, follow the line of weakness on the right side of the face to the belay above

The Main Attraction

.
content.protection: A single set of cams, draws, and possibly nuts.
content.location:
This is on the East face of the mail pillar, around the corner to the left of

The Main Attraction

.

content.description:
This is a bad idea only added to save others from repeating it.  ONA = Only Necessary Ascent.  This route consists of disconcerting chows with rope cutting potential to a ledge with a short strenuous corner that takes good gear but is too short to be worth the hassle.  From the top of the corner, wander left and up eventually reaching the anchors above, you guessed it,

The Main Attraction

.
content.location: It is on the left side of the main pillar's West face.

content.description: This is a fun crack climb with a bit of everything from a pumpy, steep start to great hands, fingers, and well-protected, spooky blocks.
content.protection: Double cams from small fingers to large, cupped hands plus nuts.  There is one protection bolt high on the route and a bolted belay on a comfortable ledge at the top.
content.location: This is the obvious hand crack on the North side of the large central pillar.  Set up the belay to avoid possible falling rock.  Rap the route from the belay bolts.

content.description:
This is a pleasant, moderate dihedral immediately right of

The Main Attraction

.  Head up to the wide corner that is much easier than it looks and climb to its top.  From there, work up and left through pretty solid and easy rock with intermittent pro to the belay above

The Main Attraction

.
content.protection: A single set of cams and nuts with an optional large piece (#4.5 C4 or so).
content.location:
It is immediately right of

The Main Attraction

.
